USERNAME_FIELD = 'email'
clientes

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

is_code_valid(code, minutes_valid=1)[fuente]

Verifica si el código es correcto y no ha expirado.

Parámetros:

  • code (str) – El código a verificar.

  • minutes_valid (int) – Minutos de validez del código.

Devuelve:

True si el código es válido, False en caso contrario.

Tipo del valor devuelto:

bool

logentry_set

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

class usuarios.models.CustomUserManager(*args, **kwargs)[fuente]

Bases: BaseUserManager

Manager para el modelo de usuario personalizado.

create_user(email, password=None, **extra_fields)[fuente]

Crea y guarda un usuario con el email y contraseña dados.

Parámetros:

  • email (str) – El email del usuario.

  • password (str) – La contraseña del usuario.

  • extra_fields – Campos adicionales para el usuario.

Devuelve:

El usuario creado.

Tipo del valor devuelto:

CustomUser
